item.title: Metals Slip Amid Dollar Strength
item.description: Base metals were weaker with gold flat, as a hawkish outlook from the Fed continued to boost haven assets like the dollar.

item.title: Oil Falls as Global Interest Rates Rise
item.description: Oil prices fell for a second day as higher interest rates globally increased the cost of holding oil and was pushing producers to sell off their stocks, ANZ said, adding that easing inflation was reducing appetite for commodities.

item.title: Siemens Energy Plummets After Scrapping Outlook
item.description: UPDATED: Siemens Energy said it was withdrawing its profit guidance for fiscal 2023 due to an extended technical review triggered after a substantial increase in wind-turbine component failure rates.

item.title: Siemens Energy Scraps Outlook on Further Gamesa Problems
item.description: Siemens Energy said it was withdrawing its profit guidance for fiscal 2023 due to an extended technical review triggered after a substantial increase in wind-turbine component failure rates.

item.title: U.S. Navy Heard What It Believed Was Implosion of Submersible Days Ago
item.description: Underwater microphones designed to detect enemy submarines first heard the suspected implosion just hours after the Titan began its voyage.

item.title: Dollar Strengthens on Prospects of More Rate Increases, Solid Economy
item.description: The dollar strengthened broadly after Jerome Powell said interest rates were likely to rise further, noting that inflation and economic activity haven’t slowed this year as much as many officials had anticipated.

item.title: Thyssenkrupp Nucera IPO Seen Valued up to €2.7 Billion
item.description: Thyssenkrupp and Industrie de Nora set the price range for the Thyssenkrupp Nucera IPO at €19-21.5, with the first day of trading on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange planned for July 7.

item.title: Eni to Buy Privately-Owned Neptune
item.description: Eni and its unit Var Energi will buy Neptune Energy’s global and Norwegian operations for around $4.9 billion, including debt.

item.title: GSK Settles Zantac Litigation in US
item.description: GSK said it reached a confidential settlement with plaintiff James Goetz regarding the legal action concerning Zantac and accusations that it causes cancer.

item.title: UK Retail Sales Unexpectedly Tick Up
item.description: Retail-sales volumes in the U.K. rose 0.3% on month in the May, helped by warm weather that boosted online trading, though the squeeze on food spending caused by high inflation persisted.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.45% on Concerns Over Japan's Economic Outlook
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average fell 1.45% to close at 32781.54 on concerns over the country’s economic outlook.

item.title: Spanish Bonds Expected to Outperform Post-Elections
item.description: Spanish government bond spreads are trading expectations for improved economic fundamentals after the July 23 elections, resulting in “optical near-term richness” versus market variables, Citi said.

item.title: Glynn's Take: Ousting of Lowe Will Raise Questions About RBA Independence
item.description: Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Philip Lowe looks likely to be unceremoniously removed from his job next month amid a new and worrying era of political pressure being exerted on the setting of interest rates.

item.title: Twitter Shows 'Strong Willingness' to Comply With Digital-Content Law, EU Regulator Says
item.description: Thierry Breton, a top tech regulator for the bloc, gave his assessment after an EU team visited Twitter’s headquarters.

item.title: Malaysia to Take Legal Action Against Meta Over 'Harmful' Content
item.description: Malaysia’s government will take legal action against Facebook parent Meta Platforms for what it said was a failure to remove harmful content from the company’s social media platform.

item.title: $248 'Digital Residency' in Tiny Nation Opens Crypto Side Door
item.description: Advertising for a program run by the Pacific island nation of Palau suggests a residency could circumvent bans on services such as Binance.

item.title: Sweet and fruity e-cigarette flavors have proliferated in the U.S. market in the three years since a federal crackdown on those flavors, according to a government analysis of e-cigarette sales data.
item.description: Sweet and fruity e-cigarette flavors have proliferated in the U.S. market in the three years since a federal crackdown on those flavors, according to a government analysis of e-cigarette sales data.

item.title: Ford is preparing for a new round of layoffs in the coming weeks, people familiar with the matter said.
item.description: Ford is preparing for a new round of layoffs in the coming weeks, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: A federal judge began hearing arguments in the FTC's lawsuit seeking to block Microsoft's proposed deal to acquire Activision.
item.description: A federal judge began hearing arguments in the FTC’s lawsuit seeking to block Microsoft’s proposed deal to acquire Activision.

item.title: 3M agreed to pay as much as $12.5 billion to settle hundreds of lawsuits brought by cities that said their drinking water was contaminated with "forever chemicals" the company made for decades.
item.description: 3M agreed to pay as much as $12.5 billion to settle hundreds of lawsuits brought by cities that said their drinking water was contaminated with “forever chemicals” the company made for decades.
